full_threads.body:
Hi Shelly and Joanne,

Thanks so much for your patience!

Just confirming everything’s good to go. You can access the login details here:
👉 Secure link for Shelly’s email and password

This link is specifically for:
  • Shelly (shelly@dontsweatit.com.au)
  • Joanne (joanne.nikolas@loreal.com)

Let me know if there's anything else I can do for you, always happy to help

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

Hi Joanne,

Our IT team will add you now.

Thanks

Shelly x

That is great news. Consider your session locked and loaded.

Ginni and I will have the courses and logins ready to go.

Maybe let me know if this is something we can work around first and then I'll send through a calendar invite with a zoom link? Thanks so much!

Ginni

Hi Joanne

We can't wait to get cracking on this!

Here is how we get access to the individual courses;

You have been added as the L'Oreal company leader

As soon as we receive payment (you have been invoiced already- let me know if you didn't receive this!) you will be able to log in to https://dontsweatit.com.au/

Top right corner is "My account" you have a unique username and password

  • Through this account, you can invite the 30 users directly
  • Each user will receive their own password, based on their email which will give them course access
  • They log in in the same way
  • Once they log in, their progress will be trackable via reports that will be available to you as company leader through the same portal.

Let me know as soon as you've submitted the payment and I will send over the PDFs associated with the course and send over your log ins along with a LOOM we use to show you how the system works!

Ginni

Dr Ginni Mansberg


 Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer

To: NIKOLAS Joanne <Joanne.NIKOLAS@loreal.com>
Subject: RE: New submission from Contact Us

Unverified Sender!

This sender is not a regular contact. Be vigilant!

Hi Joanne,

That's wonderful news!

Here are the answers to your questions;

  1. If we have less than 30 people sign up for the training, will the cost remain the same?

Yes. We recommend a maximum of 30 people per group. We recommend someone from HR/ people and culture attend even if they do not plan to become MMs

  1. What date are you available to run the training?

I am just looking at Shelly's availability. We have the following availability in September;

1st from 11m

3rd 2-5pm

10th 9-12

I get home from working in the US and UK on 5th October;

6th any time from 1pm

8th from 10am

13th any time from 11:30am

22nd 2-5pm

24th any time from 11:30am

29th any time from 1pm

Do any of these work?

  1. Is the cost inclusive of GST?

No it is exclusive of GST

  1. Will you create a link for people to register, or do we?

We can create the link. It will be housed on zoom. But also happy for you to host- whatever works better for you guys!

We will send over the links to do the online course 2 weeks before the training- which will be assumed knowledge g.

Hope that helps?

Dr Ginni Mansberg


 Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer

+61402292079
 ginni@dontsweatit.com.au
https://dontsweatit.com.au/

From: Ginni Mansberg <Ginni@dontsweatit.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 5 August 2025 2:39 PM
To: NIKOLAS Joanne <Joanne.NIKOLAS@loreal.com>; Shelly Horton <Shelly@dontsweatit.com.au>
Subject: RE: New submission from Contact Us

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hey Joanne

So lovely to hear from you again!

We loved working with the amazing team at L'Oreal

Here is some info;

Menopause Mentor Training: Empowering Peer-to-Peer Support in the Workplace

Why Menopause Mentors Matter

Research shows that people going through perimenopause and menopause overwhelmingly prefer to seek support from peers, not managers or HR. A 2021 study found that 83% of women felt menopause affected their work, yet only 30% felt comfortable speaking to their manager about it. Peer support networks, backed by expert knowledge and empathy, offer a practical, powerful alternative.

In fact, according to global best practices and the Australasian Menopause Society, peer support is a key driver of workplace wellbeing, helping employees navigate menopause, build social connection, and feel supported in their daily work lives.

Our Don't Sweat It Menopause Mentor Training is designed to create credible, approachable, and well-informed mentors. Menopause mentors are people who are ready to support their colleagues with empathy and evidence-based knowledge.

What the Training Involves

This is not just another health session. It's a science-backed, communication-focused learning experience that prepares participants to lead peer-to-peer support networks across their workplace.

✔️ Format:

  • 3-hour online training session (for up to 30 people)
  • $15,000* flat fee, including access to all materials and our online course

✔️ What's included:

  • Pre-training Online Course (1 hour): Self-paced, mobile-friendly learning covering the fundamentals of perimenopause and menopause. Completion is assumed before the live session.
  • Live Mentor Training (3 hours): Delivered online or in person by Dr Ginni and Shelly, both experts in menopause and workplace communication, the session covers:
    • How to support conversations-whether it's with bosses, direct reports, peers, or partners
    • How to create your peer to peer support network charter
    • Case based training on managing menopause in the workplace

(Chatham House rules apply)

  • 8 downloadable Fact Sheets to share within your peer-to-peer network, covering topics like:
    • Menopause insomnia
    • Brain fog
    • Managing mood changes
    • Navigating heavy bleeding at work
    • And more

Who Can Be a Menopause Mentor?

Menopause mentors can be:

  • People currently experiencing perimenopause or menopause
  • Those who've gone through it and want to give back
  • Supportive colleagues who want to understand and advocate for others

What matters most? Empathy, patience, and a desire to help-backed by expert training.

Flexible Delivery Options

We offer full flexibility in how you host the session:

  • Online for remote or distributed teams
  • In person at your office or an external venue (available on request)
  • Globally accessible for organisations with international teams

Why It Works

Our training addresses not just the "what" of menopause, but also the "how"- how to talk about it, how to support others, and how to create an open, inclusive culture. We blend:

  • The latest clinical evidence
  • Proven workplace communication strategies
  • Real-world empathy and understanding

In line with the Australian Government's priority to support older women's workforce participation, and the global call to make menopause less of a taboo and more of a supported life stage, menopause mentors are a simple but powerful step toward a healthier, more inclusive workplace.

Is this of interest to you?

*Because we have worked with L'Oreal before we would like to extend a 30% discount for this training, if you sign up by the end of September!

Warm regards,

Ginni

Dr Ginni Mansberg


 Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer

+61402292079
 ginni@dontsweatit.com.au
https://dontsweatit.com.au/

From: Don\'t Sweat It <info@dontsweatit.com.au>

To: Shelly Horton <Shelly@dontsweatit.com.au>; Info - Don't Sweat It <info@dontsweatit.com.au>; Alicia Galea <Alicia@dontsweatit.com.au>; Ginni Mansberg <Ginni@dontsweatit.com.au>
Subject: New submission from Contact Us

Other

How can we help

Hi there,
We are at the final home stretch of publishing our Menopause policy, and to truly anchor this vital policy and foster a supportive environment, we believe establishing a team of Menopause Ambassadors would be an invaluable initiative.
Seeing as you provide Menopause Mentor Training, we would like to explore this option. Could you please provide information on your availability in running this program, potentially we could run it in our offices or online.
Please let me know what other information you require,
